intro: Antrophyopsis boryana, commonly known as the Bory's antrophyopsis, is a rare and delicate plant native to the Andes mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in high-altitude, cool, and moist environments, often found in rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
